children.text: The render that has been applied across the top of the window and door sills has been finished up to the front edge of the sills, not in underneath them.

The problem with leaving the finish of the render at this point is that it will allow water and moisture to enter into the brickwork below the render, leaving it susceptible to hydrostatic pressure which will eventually cause the render to delaminate, bubble and peel off. Additionally, Part 3.3.1.10 Shrinkage Allowance for Timber Framing of the BCA requires that

‘In masonry veneer walls a gap must be left between the timber frame and the top of the masonry wall to allow for settlement of the timber framing caused by timber shrinkage. These clearances must be not less than 5mm at sills or lower and single storey windows; and 10mm at sills of second storey windows’.
These sills will have to be removed and re-installed so that the finished render has the correct clearance to the frame under the sills.
